intro: Clavija ruiziana, commonly known as the Ruiz's clavija, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Clavija ruiziana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
